1.title: Start the survey by clicking on „Start Questionnaire“
1.text: Answering the questionnaire approximately takes 5 minutes of your time and asks about acute symptoms, health conditions, travels in risky regions and contact to suspected cases. Please try to answer as accurately as possible.

2.title: List of questions and recommendations
2.text: At the end of the questionnaire you will get an overview over your answers and specific recommended actions, like

3.title: Preparation for your doctor
3.text: In case you would need to see a doctor, some testing facilities provide the possibility to scan your answers via a QR-code. The usage of the QR-code for transmitting relevant, medical information supports further care and helps to handle the high amount of patients more quickly. For a visit at your doctor or another testing laboratory you can print the summary of the questionnaire answers.

4.title: What data is transmitted via the internet?
4.text: The questionnaire is anonymous and is only edited and saved on your device (e.g., phone). Your answers will not be transmitted over the internet to us or others.

5.title: See a doctor when in doubt!
5.text: The usage of this app does not replace treatment by a medical professional. If you feel critically ill, please seek medical help immediately.

information.title: Information
information.text: The usage of this app does not replace treatment by a medical professional and does not provide a diagnostic. The app serves to improve the process in the examination centers relating to the new corona virus SARS-CoV-2. If you feel critically ill, please seek medical help or a doctor immediately.

risk_group.title: You appear to belong to a high risk group
risk_group.text_1: If you want, report yourself to the hotline of the health administration (Phone 030/9028 28 28) or present yourself at a examination center.
risk_group.text_2: If you leave the house, please keep enough distance (more than 2 metres) to other people, do not touch anything, if possible, and pay attention to the rules for correct coughing and sneezing. Please avoid unnecessary contact with other persons and stay at home.

greenlight.title: Stay at home
greenlight.text_1: Currently there does not exist a need of action for you, because you:
greenlight.item_1: had no contact to a confirmed case
greenlight.item_2: were not in a risky region in the last 14 days
greenlight.text_3: If you leave the house, please keep enough distance (more than 2 metres) to other people, do not touch anything, if possible, and pay attention to the rules for correct coughing and sneezing.

qr_code.title: Scan QR-Code
qr_code.contents: The contents of the QR-code are listed below

texts.age_65: Are you 65 years old or older?
texts.living_situation: What is your current living situation?
texts.caring: Do you personally care or support at least once a week one or more persons with age related troubles, chronic diseases or infirmity?
texts.workspace: Are you employed in one of the following categories?
texts.contact: Did you have close contact with a confirmed case?
texts.fever: Did you have fever (above 38°C) in the last 24 hours?
texts.fever_temperature: What was the highest temperature approximately?
texts.fever_last_days: Did you have fever (above 38°C) in the last 4 days?
texts.chills: Did you have shiverings in the last 24 hours?
texts.listless: Did you feel groggily or listless in the last 24 hours?
texts.body_ache: Did you have body ache in the last 24 hours?
texts.diarrhea: Did you have diarrhea in the last 24 hours?
texts.head_ache: Did you have head ache in the last 24 hours?
texts.loss_of_smell: Did you experience a loss of smell and/or taste in the last 24 hours?
texts.cough: Did you have continuing cough in the last 24 hours?
texts.sniff: Did you have a sniff in the last 24 hours?
texts.sore_throat: Did you have a sore throat in the last 24 hours?
texts.out_of_breath: Were you faster out of breath than usual in the last 24 hours?
texts.symptoms_date: Regarding all questions to symptoms: Since when did you have the symptoms?
texts.lung_disease: Were you ever diagnosed with a chronic lung disease by a doctor?
texts.diabetes: Were you ever diagnosed with diabetes by a doctor?
texts.heart_disease: Were you ever diagnosed with a heart disease by a doctor?
texts.adipositas: Were you ever diagnosed with adipositas by a doctor?
texts.cortison: Do you currently take Cortison in the form of tablettes?
texts.flu_shot: Have you been vaccinated against the flu in the period from October 2019 to today?

comments.caring: This does not suppose support and acts of care that you provide in the context of your employment.
comments.contact:
Close contact with a confirmed contact means:
  • Contact from face to face longer than 15 minutes
  • Direct, physicial contact (touch, shaking of hands, kisses)
  • Being closer to the infected person for more than 15 minutes (less than 1,5 metres distance)
  • Contact with exchange of bodily fluids/li>
  • Sharing of an appartment
If you had contact, but were equipped with adequate protection (mask, lab coat), please choose "No".
comments.cough: This question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic cough or seasonal or allergic cough. Should you have a chronic cough, please compare your current symptoms with your former symptoms.
comments.sniff: This question relates to cold symptoms and excludes chronic sniff seasonal or allergic sniff. Should you have a chronic sniff, please compare your current symptoms with your former symptoms.
comments.out_of_breath:
Choose "Yes", if you:
  • get out of breath quicker than usual when under small pressure, like taking a walk or climbing a few stairs or have difficulty breathing
  • Have the feeling of breathlessness or shortness of breath while sitting or lying
  • Get a feeling of breathlessness when standing up from a bed or a chair
Should you have a chronic lung disease, compare your current symptoms with former symptoms.
comments.immune_suppressiva: You get or take immune suppressive after an organ transplantation, during therapy of an auto immune disease or in the context of chemotherapy.

answers.living_situation_1: Together with family, in a shared flat, or in a form of assisted living
answers.workspace_0: In the medical sector (care, doctor's office or hospital)
answers.workspace_1: In community services (school, kindergarden, university, etc.)
answers.workspace_2: No, in none of the above

datepicker.months: January February March April May June July August September October November December
